metadata.Title: CVE-2016-1704 on Ubuntu 16.04 ESM (xenial) - medium.
metadata.Description:
Multiple unspecified vulnerabilities in Google Chrome before 51.0.2704.103 allow attackers to cause a denial of service or possibly have other impact via unknown vectors.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2016-1704` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

chromium-browser - 52.0.2743.116-0ubuntu0.16.04.1.1250
chromium-browser-l10n - 52.0.2743.116-0ubuntu0.16.04.1.1250
chromium-chromedriver - 52.0.2743.116-0ubuntu0.16.04.1.1250
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg - 52.0.2743.116-0ubuntu0.16.04.1.1250
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg-extra - 52.0.2743.116-0ubuntu0.16.04.1.1250
No subscription required

liboxideqt-qmlplugin - 1.15.8-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
liboxideqtcore0 - 1.15.8-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
liboxideqtquick0 - 1.15.8-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
oxideqt-codecs - 1.15.8-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
oxideqt-codecs-extra - 1.15.8-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: chromium-browser package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '52.0.2743.116-0ubuntu0.16.04.1.1250').
oxide-qt package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1.15.8-0ubuntu0.16.04.1').
